data.title: Godot Binary Won't Run:
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Manjaro XFCE 17.0.01 
Godot v2.1.3-stable_x11.64

**Issue description:**
When trying to run godot, I get the following output:

```
ERROR: initialize: Condition ' !fbc ' is true. returned: ERR_UNCONFIGURED
   At: platform/x11/context_gl_x11.cpp:103.
ERROR: initialize: Condition ' x11_window == 0 ' is true.
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:297.
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Also tried installing the AUR package but still get the same output.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download Godot
2. Extract Archive
3. Run Binary

data.title: GIProbe compression issues
data.body:
- [ ] When GIProbe compression is enabled, [this line](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f527a6946285502f8d518f054b1bebc1d3fa564e/drivers/gles3/rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp#L4783), which is

```cpp
glCompressedTexImage3D(GL_TEXTURE_3D, level, _EXT_COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5_EXT, p_width, p_height, p_depth, 0, size, NULL);
```

results in error:

> ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 84  Severity: High  Message: GL_INVALID_ENUM in glCompressedTexImage3D(target)
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

Similarly, [this line](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f527a6946285502f8d518f054b1bebc1d3fa564e/drivers/gles3/rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp#L4835)

```cpp
glCompressedTexSubImage3D(GL_TEXTURE_3D, p_mipmap, 0, 0, p_depth_slice, gipd->width >> p_mipmap, gipd->height >> p_mipmap, p_slice_count, _EXT_COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5_EXT, size, p_data);
```

yields

> ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 84  Severity: High  Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION in glCompressedTexSubImage3D(invalid target GL_TEXTURE_3D for format GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5_EXT)
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

- [ ] It uses an inline DXT5 compressor (see [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/servers/visual/visual_server_scene.cpp#L2370) and [here](
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/servers/visual/visual_server_scene.cpp#L2905)), rather than using libsquish

- [ ] This assumes S3TC support. For mobile, ETC2 could be used.

data.title: Add error printing functions to GDNative
data.body:
Wraps `_err_print_error` (called by the error macros) for the C API. That function passes errors to the Godot debugger tab and the other error handlers.

GDNative language bindings can use `godot_print_error` to implement the [error macros](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/error_macros.h) or something similar for their language.

data.title: Viewport transparent background doesnt work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, Godot Master


**Issue description:**
Rendering a viewport to a texture having the transparent flag on doesn't render a transparent image. There is always a grey background that occupies the entire viewport.
I tried with several different options (own world, setting up a new world environment, etc), but the background is always there.

data.title: Grey rendering on Mesa/Radeon r600 (Translation from TGSI failed)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
ubuntu + arch, Godot master
Card AMD Radeon 7500M/7600M

**Issue description:**
There is no lighting in the editor

**Steps to reproduce:**
Export mesh, open mesh, either dae or scene files

**Link to minimal example project:**
![screenshot_20170509_221224](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/650506/25851428/e0e87260-3504-11e7-90fd-499f650b18a2.jpg)

-----

*Bugsquad edit*: Same issue on AMD Radeon 6670, see #8774

Everything 3D is rendered grey and the terminal shows a lot of this errors:

```
EE ../../../../../src/gallium/drivers/r600/r600_shader.c:183 r600_pipe_shader_create - translation from TGSI failed !
EE ../../../../../src/gallium/drivers/r600/r600_state_common.c:800 r600_shader_select - Failed to build shader variant (type=1) -1
```

data.title: Fix Editor/Debugger connection problems.
data.body:
In this PR:

- `_socket_create` now falls back to IPv4 when requesting type IP_ANY and the current machine does not allow IPv6 sockets
- Fix local interface address detection (we where recognizing non-INET addresses as local IP addresses)
- The editor now respects the `debug_host` option pushing it as the `rdebug` argument host.
- The `network/debug_host` option is now renamed to `network/debug/remote_host` for consistency with `network/debug/remote_port`. (do you like this location? Do you want to move it to `run/debug`?)

Fixes #7544 #8563 #5828
Possibly also #2604 (but I think that the `gethostbyname` error is actually unrelated to the real problem).

data.title: Fix click area for bool property
data.body: This fix the issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8551 where you can't click the checkbox.

data.title: Resource tree expands every time you run your project
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3, Windows 10

If you collapse the subfolders of your res:// directory in the FileSystem section and then run your project, they all pop open.
This is very frustrating if you have a lot of nested folders, and I can't think of any practical/intended reason why this functionality would be present.

data.title: Fix gdscript autocomplete showing only paths
data.body: Fix #8674, and rename a few things for clarity

data.title: iPhone MFI gamepad support
data.body:
This PR adds MFI gamepad support to iOS.

I've tested this with my Mad Catz CTRLi controller and everything seems to work fine. I could not find anything about implementing rumble/vibration in Apple's documentation.

Currently the pause button and gyro/accelerometer/magnetometer access is not build in. 

There is one annoying bug I have not tracked down and that is that if the controller is not on and paired before starting Godot we get a 32bit conversion error because of some bogus uninitialised value. I don't know if this is a bug in my code, in iOS or in Mad Catz controller, I have found other people reporting it on other platforms. But its past midnight here, I'll do some more debugging tomorrow. Maybe someone else can find the mistake I've made :)

data.title: Calling hash() on array containing itself crashes without error messages
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux x86_64 / Godot 3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Calling `hash()` on an array containing itself crashes the game without error messages, possibly caused by an infinite loop in the hash function.
Expected: printed hash value, debugger breaking the program, or continue with error message
Happened: crash without error messages

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create new project & scene
2. Create new Node and attach this GDScript:

```
extends Node

func _ready():
	var arr = []
	arr.append(arr)
	print(arr.hash())
```

3. Save & run the scene

**Minimal project:**
[hasharray.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/982617/hasharray.zip)

data.title: Dropping BlackBerry 10 platform for Godot 3.0+
data.body:
@reduz already said this should be done, but I'd like to have the go from that platform's main advocate, @punto-, before going ahead with the `git rm` :)

The platform support would of course be kept in the *2.1* branch, only removed from *master* and the upcoming *3.0* branch.

data.title: Randomly getting "Condition 'p_elem->_root!=this' is true." errors?
Incorrect margin display in 2D editor viewport
data.body:
**Godot Engine v3.0.alpha.custom_build:**

Margins for controls will display incorrectly in the 2D editor viewport. They will run as designed when the game is run, the only problem is in the editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create an empty project and create a new scene.
2. Make the root node a Panel and set it's anchor to "Full Rect"
3. Set the margin for each side of the panel to 0

You should be able to see that, in the display, the panel will not go all of the way to the sides of the camera box but will form a shape in the same aspect ratio of the 2D viewport. Changing the shape of the viewport, by showing or hiding the output panel for example, will change the aspect ratio of the panel in the viewport. Running the game displays the panel as expected.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[IncorrectMargins.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/982312/ImproperMargins.zip)

data.title: Improved freelook
data.body:
- Fix movement input affecting all viewports even when clicking outside
- Freelook up movement is now relative
- Prevent tool shortcut conflict when moving
- De-hardcode tool shortcuts (select, move, rotate, scale, wireframe)
- Movement speed depends on zoom distance (like panning)
- Mouse wheel controls speed (Blender-style) due to above point
- Added zoom distance indicator, hides after short delay

Continuation of https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/8616

data.title: feature request: movement in 3d editor
data.body:
I am sure there should be request like this kicking around somewhere but right now 3d view of the scene is basically set in stone to 0,0. What I propose is to implement WASD movement. 

How this would work:
Pressing W or S moves camera on axis from camera center to pivot
![spectacle sl4998](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/25784434/b2611fc2-3375-11e7-95c3-3cf4b2f25040.png)
Pressing A or D moves camera on axis that horizontally forms 90 degree angle with WS axis
![spectacle ti4998](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/25784460/1f5627c6-3376-11e7-90e0-107d3213fcb2.png)

P.S. I know my chicken scratch drawings are kinda crap.

data.title: Light2D Mix/Mask mode issues whith other lights
data.body:
Windows 10 x64 - Gtx 680 - GD v.3.0 x64

**Hello, Godot devs...**
I have come across a very make or break issue for me in Godot, and that is when I use a light2D with the blending mode Mix or Mask and if that light2D gets close to some or sometimes all of them, light2D's then it will randomly turn off / or get cut in half... Now if I re-open the scene all the lights who is in or close to the light2D with mix/mask mode will be randomly on or of. I've been experiencing this since 2.1.x and up to now on my main win 10 computer and on my win 10 x86 laptop in the editor or exported version of the project.

![adjustment layer_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1938040/25806339/20c7ca1e-3403-11e7-80f9-dcaac3c7a312.gif)

**How I reproduce this:**
- Create at least one light2D with mask/mix mode
- Create some normal light2Ds with add mode
- Move around the light with mix mode over the other lights, if all is working as it shud try to re-open the level several times and that shud make some lights behave badly.

**Example project:**
https://www.dropbox.com/s/f0und6dkzzugxx2/Light2DModes_Project.zip?dl=0
[Light2DModes_Project.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/989466/Light2DModes_Project.zip)

data.title: Using a texture in 3D always forces a re-import and makes it darker.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux (Ubuntu 17.04), Godot 3.0 (built from master a few days ago)

**Issue description:**
I noticed something strange going on with importing textures. No matter which settings I choose, as soon as a texture is used in 3D it will get re-imported and suddenly ends up much darker (and it looks as if the colour depth is lower too). Wrong texture colours shouldn't happen in the first place, but this even happens with uncompressed import and with "detect_3d=false".

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Load a texture, use it in 2D (everything's fine).
2. Then use the texture in 3D, it will get re-imported with wrong colors.
3. Then re-import it again - 2d view is fine. 
4. Switch back to 3D view, and it gets re-imported again.
5. repeat from step 3...

It looks like this:
![texture_import](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15891496/25783876/e3b5074e-3363-11e7-8cc3-229dd9c16118.gif)

Again, I chose uncompressed texture import, and detect_3d is off. So there might be two issues here: Broken texture import and import settings not applied correctly?

data.title: Color degradation with directional shadow
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master 
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia 940M

@reduz told me at Meet the Nodes that the  Dual Paraboloid was causing colors to degrade when in shadow, and that Cube was slower but better.
Problem is, that's also the case for directional lights:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/25783130/1fcb584e-3357-11e7-8de0-305e9de7d94e.png)

Notice how colors get degraded in dark spots. It's like the color space definition is getting smaller, as if `half` was used instead of `float`.
The issue is present wether Environment effects are enabled or not, and both in game and editor.

data.title: Fix license formatting breaking GH detection
data.body:
## Pros

- We benefit from GH's (half-assed) license detection which is apparently veeery touchy, so we can't deviate much from the "standard" format.
![spectacle l32316](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/25782194/11efc662-3346-11e7-8864-ba35f6ed7b89.png)

- It fixes the issue with Markdown ignoring line wraps, producing this output:
![spectacle h32316](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/25782196/29862528-3346-11e7-8aa3-83ff86d5a2e4.png)

## Cons

- We lose that header with Godot name and URL. I added it at the bottom instead, that seems to work.
- We rename LICENSE.md to LICENSE.txt, which means links pointed to LICENSE.md will 404. I tried adding a LICENSE.md file that points to the LICENSE.txt one, but it broke GitHub's license detection, as it just checks LICENSE.md in priority and then ignores LICENSE.txt... Same thing with a symlink.
- When opened on GitHub, LICENSE.txt is formatted as plaintext with a monospace font, not as sexy Markdown... but it's not that bad IMO.

Thoughts? :)

data.title: Please use CMake
data.body:
Hello there.
My name is Ivano Arrighetta and I'm Italian.
I would like to suggest to use CMake for creating build projects for Windows and Mac OS, other than Makefiles for *nix.

I'm pretty sure everyone would benefit from this.

Bye, Ivano.
